data.title: Student Organizations | Student Leadership & Activities
data.meta_description: With 90+ student organizations on Saint Joseph's campus, every student has opportunities to join, lead and make new friends.
data.text:
We are the official student section of Saint Joseph's athletics, offering students the chance to enjoy Hawks games in a unique way. We aim to increase everyone's school spirit and make their time on Hawk Hill more enjoyable by bridging the gap between the average student and the university's sports teams.

Contact | Website | Facebook | Instagram

The Saint Joseph’s University American Marketing Association is a collegiate chapter of the American Marketing Association, that provides an environment focused on the professional development of students. The SJU AMA is devoted to helping its members, student body and community make great strides in teaching, communicating and connecting with a plethora of marketing resources.

Our chapter provides a fun and exciting environment that allows students to be exposed to industry professionals who educate our members on trends within the industry and share valuable advice for a successful future. The SJU AMA serves as a liaison between the learning that occurs in a classroom setting and the professional world. It is our greatest hope that our members enter the professional world with the knowledge, resources, confidence and ethical values for a prosperous future.

Contact | Website | Facebook | Instagram

The Autism Club at Saint Joseph’s University is a group of action-oriented students at Saint Joseph’s University that aims to become advocates for autistic individuals and bridge the gap between SJU students of all abilities.

The purpose of this club shall be: Provide peer support and promote self-advocacy, Bridge the gap between neurodiverse and neurotypical peers and Create a lasting change of how autism is viewed, on and off campus

College Republicans is a club designed to bring together republicans on campus and engage in hot topics of conversation. We strive to provide a safe space for those with the minority opinion around campus. Weekly meetings allow for up to date conversations about current issues and events.

Instagram

The Delta Sigma Theta Sorority, Inc. is an organization with chapter members that are committed to service. We host events with a focus on uplifting, informing and educating the community. The Epsilon Phi Chapter was chartered on March 27, 1966, and recognizes five universities, including Saint Joseph's University.

Contact | Website | Facebook | Instagram

We bring together musicians of all skill levels who want to play with other musicians in a relaxed environment where everyone can share their skills, learn from others, and work together. The main focus of meeting swill be a show and tell where everyone gets a chance to share what they are working on, and then a group jam where we all play a song together,

The mission of Sigma Sigma Sigma is to provide lasting friendships and connections during a woman's four years on campus, as well as their life after college. Additionally, we serve our community through various philanthropic events. We are especially committed to Tri Sigma's national charity, the Robbie Page Memorial Foundation.

Instagram

The purpose of the club is to provide an opportunity for students of any major interested in investing to learn about and practice trading in a low stakes environment. The club does trade real dollars and instead “paper trades” with a fictional sum that is “invested” as per real market prices in stocks, bonds, etc. Members of the club meet bi-weekly to vote on buying, selling, or holding certain assets. Dividing into teams, members research specific sectors of the stock market and then pitch their stock ideas to the other members who vote on what decisions to make in the club-wide portfolio. An optional individual competition portion of the club allows members to manage fictional money on their own and attempt to be the most profitable in the club.

Website

SJU Theatre Company is the premiere theatre producing organization at Saint Joseph's University in Philadelphia Pennsylvania. It has produced plays & musicals on the campus of Saint Joseph's University for over 80 years. The theatre company is supported by the Department of Music, Theatre & Film which offers courses in performance (acting, directing, musical theatre), music and film. It is also supported by the Department of English, offering courses in dramaturgy, playwriting, and dramatic literature. Productions are performed in Bluett Theatre, a 440 seat proscenium theatre on the campus. Productions are directed by faculty and and often incorporate professional guest artists (musical directors, choreographers, designers, etc) from both Philadelphia and New York City.

Website | Facebook | Instagram
